greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least integer of each prime signature ordered first by sum of exponents and then by least integer value.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..26, flattened
mathematica: b[n_, i_, l_] := b[n, i, l] = If[n == 0, Join[{Product[Prime[t]^l[[t]], {t, 1, Length[l]}]}], If[i == 1, b[0, 0, Join[l, Table[1, {n}]]], Join[b[n, i - 1, l], If[i > n, {}, b[n - i, i, Append[l, i]]]]]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 06 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Ray Chandler_, Sep 04 2003
